title-group.article-title: Statistical Problems with Using Variance-Type Calculations When Growth Exists

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1996 Journal of Financial Education, Jean L. Heck

abstract.p: The methodologies for calculating asset and portfolio risk normally presented in finance courses consider deviations about the historical mean return only. When asset returns are systematically increasing (decreasing), such an approach almost always results in a downward (upward) bias in expected return and an upward bias in the risk measure. We describe here a simple approach to reducing such biases, intended to be incorporated into a graduate or advanced undergraduate course lecture on risk computation methodologies.
